items.title: Wolves willing to sell striker Strand Larsen
items.summary: Wolves are open to selling striker Jorgen Strand Larsen this month, amid interest from Nottingham Forest.

items.title: Roma chief: Amorim axe has changed Zirkzee plan
items.summary: Roma sporting director Ricky Massara has hinted that a planned move for Joshua Zirkzee may be on the backburner following Ruben Amorim's Manchester United sacking.

items.title: Glasner: No time for Utd links, Guehi may join City
items.summary: Crystal Palace coach Oliver Glasner is unbothered by links with the Manchester United job and admitted that captain Marc GuÃ©hi could join Manchester City.

items.title: O'Neil replaces Rosenior as new Strasbourg boss
items.summary: Strasbourg have confirmed the appointment of Gary O'Neill as their new head coach following the departure of Liam Rosenior to Chelsea.

items.title: Cherki has excelled for Manchester City â€“ and made Guardiola adapt
items.summary: In a bad season for big-money transfers in the Premier League, maverick Frenchman has been a notable exception By WhoScored â€œThere are moments I just want to shout at him and there are moments I want to kiss him.â€ Such is Pep Guardiolaâ€™s relationship with Rayan Cherki: part exasperation, part adoration.â€‹ Guardiola is footballâ€™s master of fine-tuning. He has polished footballers until their natural instincts have become dictated by a system of control, structure and repetition above individual sparks of brilliance. Cherki, however, feels different â€“ a sharp, unpredictable edge that Guardiola has left intact. The 22-year-old, who arrived from Lyon in the summer for Â£34mâ€‹, is already testing Guardiolaâ€™s philosophy of shaping players rather than accommodating them. His approach to Cherki feels very different to previous big signings. When Jack Grealish arrived from Aston Villa for Â£100m in 2022, he was one of English footballâ€™s most audacious, improvisational talents â€“ a player unafraid of expression. Continue reading...

items.title: Ajax denkt aan Man United-controleur Ugarte, ook Blind blijft in beeld
items.summary: In de zoektocht naar een nieuwe nummer 6 schaakt Ajax op meerdere borden. Manuel Ugarte (24) van Manchester United is daarvoor serieus in beeld, maar de club denkt ook opnieuw aan het terughalen van Daley Blind (35).

items.title: Football Daily | West Ham and a cautionary tale of being careful what you wish for
items.summary: Sign up now! Sign up now! Sign up now? Sign up now! While precisely nobody else thought to say so at the time, when those West Ham fans who were howling for the head of Tin Pot-winning saviour David Moyes two years ago, Football Daily wondered if â€“ whisper it â€“ they should be careful what they wished for. While the turgid meat-and-potatoes fare served up by Moyesâ€™s Irons was undeniably unpleasant on the eye, arguably the sole benefit of the clubâ€™s relocation to the London Stadium was that those fans were now seated in a different postcode from the pitch, meaning they couldnâ€™t actually see what was happening anyway. The year 2026 isnâ€™t even a week old and already it has torpedoed the Premier League ambitions of Ruben Amorim and Enzo Maresca. And, as if his first name wasnâ€™t a big enough clue, Nancy joined the long list of things in Glasgow that are taken away after being deep fried at Celtic. On top of that, poor Gianni Infantino will have to create a new Fifa award celebrating armed exploration for South American oil. Roll on Februaryâ€ â€“ Mark McFadden. Re: yesterdayâ€™s Football Daily. Iâ€™m probably missing some clever point about football financing here, but why on earth would Chelsea give Liam Rosenior a contract to 2032? Including interim managers/coaches/whatever else they insist on calling themselves (because, letâ€™s face it, who knows whoâ€™s actually interim, and who isnâ€™t, any more), Chelsea have had eight different managers in the previous seven years. Surely they are just setting themselves up for a massive payout when they change managers again in (statistically) no more than 12 monthsâ€™ time?â€ â€“ Phil Taverner. No idea how many (mainly Scottish) pedants will point out that Noble Francisâ€™s claim â€“ that Celtic â€˜donâ€™t have to play Hearts again [this season], obviouslyâ€™ (yesterdayâ€™s Football Daily letters) â€“ is false. Because, in fact, Celtic have to play Hearts again in the league at least once (scheduled for 25 January). In addition, since both Hearts and Celtic are almost certain to be in the top half of the Premiership after the split at 33 games, then probably Celtic still have to play Hearts again twice in the current league season. Also, they could end up playing each other at some point in the Scottish Cupâ€ â€“ Dylan Drummond (and 1,056 other mainly Scottish pedants). This is an extract from our daily football email â€¦ Football Daily. To get the full version, just visit this page and follow the instructions. Continue reading...

items.title: World Cup players to have lifelike â€˜AI avatarsâ€™ for use in VAR offside decisions
items.summary: Innovation means every player being digitally scanned Infantino: Move will ensure more accurate decisions Every player at this summerâ€™s World Cup will have their own physically accurate â€œAI avatarâ€ that will be used in taking VAR decisions. The innovation, which will involve every player being digitally scanned and leaves the possibility of size mattering in future offside calls, was part of a package of technological measures announced by Fifaâ€™s president, Gianni Infantino, as he made a keynote appearance at the Consumer Electronic Show in Las Vegas. Continue reading...

items.title: Younes Namli zet meteen de toon na rentree bij PEC: 'Ik wil de play-offs halen'
items.summary: Ineens was hij daar weer. Terwijl de sneeuw het trainingskamp van PEC Zwolle ontregelde, werkte de club achter de schermen aan de verrassende terugkeer van Younes Namli. De 31-jarige Deen heeft een helder doel voor ogen. 'Ik wil de play-offs halen.'

items.title: 'Time for change is now' - Hamilton makes birthday pledge
items.summary: Lewis Hamilton says "the time for change is now" after a "very draining year" as he sent a message to his fans on his 41st birthday.

items.title: Arteta prijst 'geweldige' Slot voor clash: 'De verschillen zijn klein'
items.summary: Arsenal-manager Mikel Arteta kijkt uit naar de topper tegen het Liverpool van collega Arne Slot. The Gunners hebben als koploper een riante voorsprong op nummer vier Liverpool, maar de Spanjaard rekent zichzelf niet rijk in aanloop naar de ontmoeting in het Emirates Stadium.

items.title: 'Battle of the Sexes was pointless with women's tennis taking a hit'
Is parity in the Premier League a sign of quality -- or do these teams just stink?
items.summary: The gap between 5th place and 14th in the Premier League standings is four points. Does that mean the league is full of good teams, or bad ones?

items.title: What Rosenior and Fletcher will bring to Chelsea, Man United
items.summary: Chelsea's Liam Rosenior and Man United's Darren Fletcher will take their first steps this week.

items.title: Littler, Van Veen and Humphries headline Bahrain and Saudi Arabia Darts Masters
items.summary: Luke Littler, Gian van Veen and Luke Humphries will headline this year's Bahrain Darts Masters and Saudi Arabia Darts Masters, as the 2026 World Series of Darts gets under way this month.

items.title: Slot concedes Liverpoolâ€™s approach has grown dull: â€˜I would not completely disagreeâ€™
items.summary: Liverpool manager says team struggling to create â€˜My teams always try to play attacking footballâ€™ Arne Slot has said it hurts his principles as an attacking coach to hear his Liverpool team described as boring but he could not entirely disagree on current form. Liverpool have stabilised after a damaging sequence of nine defeats in 12 matches, the clubâ€™s worst return in 71 years, with a nine-game unbeaten run but are struggling to produce convincing performances. Successive draws against Fulham and Leeds have prompted further criticism of Slotâ€™s style and resulted in the champions falling 14 points behind the leaders, Arsenal, who they face at the Emirates Stadium on Thursday. Continue reading...

items.title: Carrick and Solskjaer frontrunners for caretaker role
items.summary: Michael Carrick and Ole Gunnar Solskjaer emerge as frontrunners to become Manchester United's caretaker manager until the end of the season.

items.title: Spurs head coach Martin Ho: â€˜Weâ€™re not even 15% of the way to where I want us to beâ€™
items.summary: Leader of resurgent WSL side on what he demands of players, his relationship with the hierarchy and the change that has surprised him Tottenham have as many points in the Womenâ€™s Super League this term, at the halfway stage, as they accumulated in the entirety of last season. That sentence will offer some satisfaction to their supporters but the head coach, Martin Ho, demonstrates how serious his intentions are when he says: â€œWeâ€™re not even 15% of the way to where I want us to be.â€ Ho, appointed in July, uses a specific word four times across the course of the conversation: â€œStandards.â€ The former Manchester United assistant coach inherited a team that had finished second from bottom and has Spurs two points off a European place, but he wants them to challenge themselves further. Continue reading...
